newsitem.title: MEXICO: Cemex profits soar in fourth quarter.
newsitem.headline: Cemex profits soar in fourth quarter.

text.p: The net profits of Mexican cement maker Cemex SA soared to 1.794 billion pesos in the fourth quarter of 1996, up from 6.895 million pesos in the same quarter the year before, the company reported on Friday.
Earnings per ADR share in the fourth quarter were 2.82 pesos, or $0.36, based on an average of 1,243,898,988 shares in circulation, Cemex said in a statement.
Revenues from all of the company's divisions totalled 6.884 billion pesos ($874 million) in the fourth quarter, up five percent from the same quarter of 1995.

Revenues from the Mexico unit accounted for 45 percent of that total while the Spain unit contributed 19 percent of sales, Venezuela 12 percent, the United States 11 percent, Colombia seven percent and Panama and the Caribbean together six percent, the firm said.
Cemex operating profits were 1.498 billion pesos ($190 million) in Q4 1996, down two percent from the same quarter a year earlier.

"During the quarter, the operating margin decreased to 21.8 percent from 23.4 percent in 1995, primarily because of higher (administrative expenses and cost of sales) at the various subsidiaries," Cemex said.
Cash flow increased five percent to 2.026 billion pesos ($257 million) during the quarter and seven percent to 8.568 billion pesos ($1.087 billion) for the year, the company said.
In addition, the company's debt-to-equity ratio was 53 percent at the close of 1996, Cemex said.

Sales and cash flow in Cemex's Mexico unit grew by 32 percent in dollar terms in the fourth quarter, largely as a result of greater sales volumes for concrete and ready mix cement, the corporate director of finance, Rodrigo Trevino, said in the news release.
